info.description:
The Rest Api provides programmatic access to command and control a NiFi instance in real time. Start and 
                                            stop processors, monitor queues, query provenance data, and more. Each endpoint below includes a description,
                                            definitions of the expected input and output, potential response codes, and the authorizations required
                                            to invoke each service.
info.title: NiFi Rest Api

get.summary: Gets the status the client's access
get.description: Note: This endpoint is subject to change as NiFi and it's REST API evolve.

400.description: NiFi was unable to complete the request because it was invalid. The request should not be retried without modification.

401.description: Unable to determine access status because the client could not be authenticated.

403.description: Unable to determine access status because the client is not authorized to make this request.

409.description: Unable to determine access status because NiFi is not in the appropriate state.

500.description: Unable to determine access status because an unexpected error occurred.

get.summary: Retrieves the access configuration for this NiFi

post.summary: Creates a single use access token for downloading FlowFile content.
post.description: The token returned is a base64 encoded string. It is valid for a single request up to five minutes from being issued. It is used as a query parameter name 'access_token'.

403.description: Client is not authorized to make this request.

409.description: Unable to create the download token because NiFi is not in the appropriate state. (i.e. may not have any tokens to grant or be configured to support username/password login)

500.description: Unable to create download token because an unexpected error occurred.

post.summary: Creates a token for accessing the REST API via Kerberos ticket exchange / SPNEGO negotiation
post.description: The token returned is formatted as a JSON Web Token (JWT). The token is base64 encoded and comprised of three parts. The header, the body, and the signature. The expiration of the token is a contained within the body. The token can be used in the Authorization header in the format 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'.

400.description: NiFi was unable to complete the request because it was invalid. The request should not be retried without modification.

401.description: NiFi was unable to complete the request because it did not contain a valid Kerberos ticket in the Authorization header. Retry this request after initializing a ticket with kinit and ensuring your browser is configured to support SPNEGO.

409.description: Unable to create access token because NiFi is not in the appropriate state. (i.e. may not be configured to support Kerberos login.

500.description: Unable to create access token because an unexpected error occurred.

post.summary: Creates a token for accessing the REST API via username/password
post.description: The token returned is formatted as a JSON Web Token (JWT). The token is base64 encoded and comprised of three parts. The header, the body, and the signature. The expiration of the token is a contained within the body. The token can be used in the Authorization header in the format 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'.

400.description: NiFi was unable to complete the request because it was invalid. The request should not be retried without modification.

403.description: Client is not authorized to make this request.

409.description: Unable to create access token because NiFi is not in the appropriate state. (i.e. may not be configured to support username/password login.

500.description: Unable to create access token because an unexpected error occurred.

post.summary: Creates a single use access token for accessing a NiFi UI extension.
post.description: The token returned is a base64 encoded string. It is valid for a single request up to five minutes from being issued. It is used as a query parameter name 'access_token'.

403.description: Client is not authorized to make this request.

409.description: Unable to create the download token because NiFi is not in the appropriate state. (i.e. may not have any tokens to grant or be configured to support username/password login)

500.description: Unable to create download token because an unexpected error occurred.

get.summary: Gets an access policy for the specified action and resource
get.description: Will return the effective policy if no component specific policy exists for the specified action and resource. Must have Read permissions to the policy with the desired action and resource. Permissions for the policy that is returned will be indicated in the response. This means the client could be authorized to get the policy for a given component but the effective policy may be inherited from an ancestor Process Group. If the client does not have permissions to that policy, the response will not include the policy and the permissions in the response will be marked accordingly. If the client does not have permissions to the policy of the desired action and resource a 403 response will be returned.

Updating this value is a passive change in the sense that it won't impact whether existing files over the limit are affected but it does help feeder processors to stop pushing too much into this work queue.

remoteProcessGroups.description: The ids of the remote process groups in this snippet. These ids will be populated within each response. They can be specified when creating a snippet. However, once a snippet has been created its contents cannot be modified (these ids are ignored during update requests).

processors.description: The ids of the processors in this snippet. These ids will be populated within each response. They can be specified when creating a snippet. However, once a snippet has been created its contents cannot be modified (these ids are ignored during update requests).

inputPorts.description: The ids of the input ports in this snippet. These ids will be populated within each response. They can be specified when creating a snippet. However, once a snippet has been created its contents cannot be modified (these ids are ignored during update requests).

outputPorts.description: The ids of the output ports in this snippet. These ids will be populated within each response. They can be specified when creating a snippet. However, once a snippet has been created its contents cannot be modified (these ids are ignored during update requests).

connections.description: The ids of the connections in this snippet. These ids will be populated within each response. They can be specified when creating a snippet. However, once a snippet has been created its contents cannot be modified (these ids are ignored during update requests).

labels.description: The ids of the labels in this snippet. These ids will be populated within each response. They can be specified when creating a snippet. However, once a snippet has been created its contents cannot be modified (these ids are ignored during update requests).

funnels.description: The ids of the funnels in this snippet. These ids will be populated within each response. They can be specified when creating a snippet. However, once a snippet has been created its contents cannot be modified (these ids are ignored during update requests).

clusterNodeId.description: The identifier for the node where the state originated.

clusterNodeAddress.description: The label for the node where the state originated.

totalEntryCount.description: The total number of state entries. When the state map is lengthy, only of portion of the entries are returned.

field.description: The name of the status field.

label.description: The label for the status field.

description.description: The description of the status field.

formatter.description: The formatter for the status descriptor.

generated.description: When the status history was generated.

componentDetails.description: A Map of key/value pairs that describe the component that the status history belongs to

fieldDescriptors.description: The Descriptors that provide information on each of the metrics provided in the status history

aggregateSnapshots.description: A list of StatusSnapshotDTO objects that provide the actual metric values for the component. If the NiFi instance is clustered, this will represent the aggregate status across all nodes. If the NiFi instance is not clustered, this will represent the status of the entire NiFi instance.

nodeSnapshots.description: The NodeStatusSnapshotsDTO objects that provide the actual metric values for the component, for each node. If the NiFi instance is not clustered, this value will be null.

canRead.description: Indicates whether the user can read a given resource.

identifier.description: The identifier of this storage location. The identifier will correspond to the identifier keyed in the storage configuration.

freeSpaceBytes.description: The number of bytes of free space.

totalSpaceBytes.description: The number of bytes of total space.

usedSpaceBytes.description: The number of bytes of used space.

clusterNodeId.description: The identifier of the node where to submit the replay request.

aggregateSnapshot.description: A systems diagnostic snapshot that represents the aggregate values of all nodes in the cluster. If the NiFi instance is a standalone instance, rather than a cluster, this represents the stats of the single instance.

nodeSnapshots.description: A systems diagnostics snapshot for each node in the cluster. If the NiFi instance is a standalone instance, rather than a cluster, this may be null.

totalNonHeapBytes.description: Total number of bytes allocated to the JVM not used for heap

usedNonHeapBytes.description: Total number of bytes used by the JVM not in the heap space

freeNonHeapBytes.description: Total number of free non-heap bytes available to the JVM

maxNonHeapBytes.description: The maximum number of bytes that the JVM can use for non-heap purposes

totalHeapBytes.description: The total number of bytes that are available for the JVM heap to use

usedHeapBytes.description: The number of bytes of JVM heap that are currently being used

freeHeapBytes.description: The number of bytes that are allocated to the JVM heap but not currently being used

maxHeapBytes.description: The maximum number of bytes that can be used by the JVM

availableProcessors.description: Number of available processors if supported by the underlying system.

processorLoadAverage.description: The processor load average if supported by the underlying system.

uri.description: The URI for the template.

groupId.description: The id of the Process Group that the template belongs to.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when this template was created.

encodingVersion.description: The encoding version of this template.

revision.description: The revision for this request/response. The revision is required for any mutable flow requests and is included in all responses.

position.description: The position of this component in the UI if applicable.
